info.label: IT Engineer
info.brief: The DevOps culture enables me to explore new stuff all the time. Jack of all trades by design, I have a strong knowledge about IT infrastructure and also did a bunch of development using python, golang or even PHP. Quality over quantity kind of person. Now looking for a SRE or IT architect position.

highlights: Moved from a single prod server to a redundant infra with scalability and simplicity in mind, while staying on bare metal.
Wrote tools to handle build and deployment pipelines for the monolithic web app. Had to simplify processes for IT and developers alike.
Moved out a custom scrapping service from the PHP app, made it more scalable on Python by using threads and multi process.
Implemented app/infra monitoring via Datadog API and logging with ELK stack.
Hired and managed 2 junior IT engineers and multiple interns.
Wrote and presented multiple tech sessions focusing Docker, basic web networking, cloud and basic security rules.

Made a technological shift from bare metal to cloud for one of our customers, a french automobile manufacturer, in about 6 months with 2 people. Every single piece of the tech stack had to be running using Kubernetes, leading to a uniformisation of all infras.
Fixing hardware, training people to use open source tools and make basic web operations.
Study, conception, implementation of systems and networking in a startup environment. The main goal was to make a cluster redundant enough to lower downtimes.
Started from scratch, called for some new tools like HAProxy to handle caching in a more standard way instead of relying on fragile custom app caching.
Front integration of cuir-city.com (symfony) and backend upgrades of motoblouz.com (magento).
Discovery and implementation of agile workflow, TDD.
Wrote bash scripts for maintenance operations and monitoring.
Rewrote a file tree monitoring executable with a focus on performance.
Computed file checksums on the fly.
